chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Celeste K Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 AMENDED FROM Fraud Against Financial Institution, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay restitution within 60 days.
Defendant must pay the DNA surcharge within 60 days or spend 9 days in jail consecutive.  Defendant must pay court costs within 60 days or spend 9 days in jail.
